Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance as to Angel Carrasquillo-Fontanez(3), Carlos Gonzalez-Baez(6), Edgar Pedraza-Cruz(18), Yomil Torres-Reyes(19) held on 8/7/2013. Present: AUSA Alberto Lopez, Teresa Zapata, SAUSA Victor Acevedo and Cesar Rivera. Defendants were provided with copy of the Indictment and advised as to the charges and their rights. After reviewing the CJA-23 form filled by defendants, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Defendants will be represented by counsel. Defendants ordered temporarily detained pending hearings. Govt. request case to be unsealed. Arraignment/Detention set for 8/12/2013 at 2:30 PM in Courtroom 10 before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. (amr) (Entered: 08/08/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Arraignment/Detention as to Yomil Torres-Reyes (19) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 8/12/2013. Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata, Alberto Lopez and Atty Benito Rodriguez. Dft is UC. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to count(s) 1,2,3,4,5,6. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Daniel R. Dominguez for trial setting. As to bail, defense counsel informed that they had nothing to offer but reseve the right to reopen the hearing if evidence is available. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 02:30.Hearing held at 01:43.Hearing ended at 01:46.Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (al) Modified on 8/15/2013 to edit text (cm). (Entered: 08/13/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Initial Appearance as to Tania Diaz-Vazquez held on 8/12/2013. Defense counsel Ramon Gonzalez was present. Defendant was interviewed by the Probation Officer and was brought before the Magistrate Judge, was advised of rights and provided with copy  of the indictment. Financial Affidavit was issued and approved. A CJA counsel will be appointed to represent defendant. Previous to the hearing, AUSA Victor Acevedo informed that he had no objection that bond be set. The Court set bond as to Tania Diaz- Vazquez (31) in the amount of $20,000 unsecured. Standard release conditions and curfew are imposed. Arraignment set for 8/21/2013 09:15 AM in Courtroom 8 before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll. (br) (Entered: 08/13/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez:Arraignment/Detention as to Ismael Miranda-Reyes (30) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 8/12/2013. Present: AUSA Victor Acevedo Atty Omar Oquendo. Dft is UC. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to count(s) 1,2,3,4,5. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions.Case is referred to Judge Daniel R. Dominguez for trial setting. Defense counsel argued to bail. Gvmt moved for detention. After hearing the parties, the Court ordered defendant detained without bail in base of danger to the community. The Court is willing to reopen bail hearing if third party custodian makes commitment in compliance and conditions are followed. Order to issue. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Detention Hearings as to Jimmy Montanez-Roman (25) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 8/16/2013. SAUSA Victor Acevedo and defense counsel Irma R. Valldejuli were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Detention, the Government proffered as to defendant's role as a seller and his participation in the case and moved for detention. Defense counsel was heard by proffer and requested be released on bail. After hearing the parties, the Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. Defense counsel informed of defendant's serious medical or mental condition that entitles defendant to receive disability benefits and requested that he be afforded medical attention and/or treatment at MDC. The Court ordered that minutes be e-mailed to BOP. (MDC by e-mail) (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 03:19. Hearing ended at 03:36. Interpreter Felix Toledo. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Bail Hearing as to Luis Roque-Colon (13) held on 10/8/2013. AUSA Teresa Zapata and defense counsel Rosa Bonini were present. The parties stipulated a bond of $5,000 unsecured. After listening to the parties, the Court raised the unsecured bond to $15,000 unsecured. The Court set bond as to Luis Roque-Colon (13) in the amount of $15,000 unsecured. Standard release conditions, electronic monitoring device with cell phone location monitoring to be switched to landline once installed, work, drug testing, reside with grandmother, and not enter, reside, get near or visit the Brisas del Turabo Public Housing Projects are all imposed. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 09:15. Hearing held at 10:25. Hearing ended at 10:38. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (br) (Entered: 10/08/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Bail Hearings as to Josue Cosme-Roman (27) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 9/17/2014. AUSA Alberto Lopez and defense counsel Juan Milanes were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. During the colloquy, the Court asked defendant if he was aware of the maximum penalties, for defendant answered in the affirmative. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case 1s referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Bail, defense counsel had nothing to offer at this time to rebut the presumption, but reserved the right to reopen the matter of bail. Reservation was noted by the Court. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 01:30. Hearing held at 02:01. Hearing ended at 02:05. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Daniel R. Dominguez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Ismael Miranda-Reyes (30) held on 5/20/2016. Present were: AUSA Evelyn Canals, AFPD Yasmin Irizarry and USPO Guillermo Arbona. Defendant present O/B and assisted by the court interpreter. USPO Probation Officer advised that defendant completed an in-patient program. Violation charges not contested. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment were heard on behalf of defendant. Defense counsel request that defendant be allowed to remain at treatment facility until housing is secured. After having heard the parties, the Court finds that defendant violated conditions of supervised release. However, after considering defendant's progress in the inpatient substance treatment, the Court will not revoke the supervised release term at this time. However, an additional condition will be added: "The defendant shall not purchase, use, or administer any alcohol or frequent any businesses whose primary function is to serve alcoholic beverages." A stern warning is given to Mr. Miranda Reyes and is ordered to fully comply will all conditions of supervised release. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.) Hearing set for 10:30. Hearing held at 10:47. Hearing ended at 10:54. Interpreter Marie Hernandez. (amr) (Entered: 05/24/2016)

ORDER as to Marcos Rodriguez-Maldonado (2). Pursuant to Federal Rule of Appellate Procedure 4(b)(1), "a defendant's notice of appeal must be filed in the district court  within 14 days after... the entry of... the order being appealed." However, "[u]pon a finding of excusable neglect or good cause, the district court may--before or after the time has expired, with or without motion and notice--extend the time to file a notice of appeal for a period not to exceed 30 days from the expiration of the" aforementioned 14- day period. Fed. R. App. P. 4(b)(4). As this is a case where the notice of appeal was filed after the required 14 days, but before the subsequent 30 days, the First Circuit has ordered that this Court determine whether it will deem the instant notice of appeal timely. Prior to ruling, the Court requested information from the Bureau of Prisons and the Federal Public Defender's Office. See Docket No. 1088 . The Federal Public Defender's Office response is found at Docket No. 1089 and the Bureau of Prisons' response is found at Docket No. 1091 . After meticulous scrutiny of the record and careful consideration, the Court must deem the notice of appeal untimely. The Court shall explain its reasoning. Defendant alleges in his notice of appeal that he received notice of the Court's denial of his motion for reduction of sentence on August 8, 2016. See Docket No. 1081 . However, on July 22, 2016, Defendant received a letter from the Federal Public Defender's Office that stated that the motion to reduce his sentence was denied in an order dated July 15, 2016 and advising Defendant of his right to appeal, and the time frame for doing so. See Docket No. 1089 , Exhibit 1. Even if the Court were to equitably take July 22, 2016, as the notification date for the order being appealed, Defendant's notice of appeal, filed on August 16, 2016, does not comply with the 14-day deadline. Moreover, Defendant has not demonstrated "good cause" or "excusable neglect" for the delay. Notwithstanding, even an independent inspection of the record yields no reason for which to find "good cause" or "excusable neglect." Pursuant to the First Circuit's instructions, copies of this ruling shall be forwarded to the First Circuit forthwith. See Docket No. 1087 . Signed by Judge Daniel R. Dominguez on 10/5/2016. (JM) (Entered: 10/05/2016)
